subject: [Lab 10] Q3: Evaluating Call Expressions
content:
Q3: Evaluating Call Expressions

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q3: Evaluating Call Expressions in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: Where to start for this problem? So far I just have self.apply(env) to apply the operator to the operands?

follow-ups.feedback: Make sure you are evaluating the operator and operands, and then applying the evaluated operator to the evaluated operands

threads.question: When I try to evaluate the operands, I keep getting the error that the "list object has no attribute eval". How else am I supposed to evaluate the operands?

follow-ups.feedback: Remember than `self.operands` is a list of operands, not an operand by itself
So do I evaluate each individual element in the list of operands? I don't see any other way of doing it.

threads.question: I am trying to iterate through the operands, and apply the evaluated operator to each evaluated operand, but I keep getting the following error:                     TypeError: 'Number' object is not iterable     Any ideas on what I might be doing wrong?

follow-ups.feedback: Actually, I just fixed this bug, but now I return 4 instead of "Number(4)." Any idea why?
Turns out it was because I was printing, not returning.
I got the same problem and I'm exactly the same thing. Could you give me some hint on how to solve this?
i have the same problem too :/
Not OP but I had a similar issue and in my case, I was way overthinking the iteration.

threads.question: I keep getting the error: "Number" object has no attribute eval  I thought all operands were instances of the Expr class![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjxuxy6vhrxp3v5%2Fk2q4356kxcuy%2FScreenshot_20191108_at_4.23.37_AM.png)

follow-ups.feedback: nevermind, to fix this, I used a different variable to assign my new list and not 'self.operands'

threads.question: For some reason I can't seem to be able to run the lab.  Whenever I put any command into the console, this pops up:
How do I update the environment? In the doctests its made to update a, but how do I know which value in the environment to update, or whether I should make a new value in the environment?

follow-ups.feedback: Calling a function creates a new environment in which the formal parameters are newly defined, according to the arguments, and then the function is applied in that environment.
